column4: I'm just trying to create a good Ext3 partition.  I know PartitionMagic can but it's called a Linux Ext3 and I'm worried about using it with XP.
It is just tring to frighten you away from it. Windows can read/write to linux partitions.
For the driver, see pm from ubotu.
Yes.
Like ubotu said, you will need a driver. http://www.fs-driver.org
After. Or before. Dosnt really matter.
Logical.
What do you mean?
Oooh.... Well, windows cannot run ext3 if that is teh ONLY partition...
What are their sizes?
So, you are repartitioning the second drive, but not the first?
Ok, so make the second drive be all ext3 AFTER you install the driver.
Dont worry, it is not broken, it is just easier this way.
It is ok.
Yes.
Did you have any data on that drive? Because if so, it is gone.
It is easy, aslong as you do it from windows.
np
Type the first few letters, like firefox, and then tab.
ah ic thanks

how do you register in this IRC channel?
